movies.title: Fantabulous Inc.
movies.originalTitle: La donna, il sesso e il superuomo
movies.plot: A company specializing in international espionage turns a young man into a super hero and offers his services to the United Nations. For a hefty fee, the creation will supposedly become an international policeman who will fight crime and make the world safe from the machination of evil.
movies.simplePlot: A company specializing in international espionage turns a young man into a super hero and offers his services to the United Nations. For a hefty fee, the creation will supposedly become an ...

biography.bio: Musclebound actor Richard Harrison was one of a slew of handsome young American pectoral hunks of the late 50s whose career in Hollywood amounted to little more than brawny bits until being lured to Italy and churning out the sword-and-sandal pictures that became an early 60s craze. Harrison would end up making over 100 films due to this lucky trek abroad. Born on May 26, 1936 in Salt Lake City, he relocated to sunny Southern California in his late teens where his blond, tanned, chiseled good looks (he was sometimes mistaken for handsome actor Guy Madison) landed him modeling work both on runways and in beefcake magazines. It didn't take long for him to be noticed by Hollywood casting agents. At first cast in small he-man roles, usually as a virile guy in uniform, he can be obscurely seen in Jeanne Eagels (1957), his film debut starring Kim Novak, Kronos (1957) with Jeff Morrow, Too Much, Too Soon (1958) starring Dorothy Malone, South Pacific (1958), in which he can be glimpsed as a co-pilot, and Battle Flame (1959) with Scott Brady and a young Robert Blake. While filming another minor role in Master of the World (1961) he met producer James H. Nicholson's daughter, Loretta, and married her within six months. The couple produced three sons. Frustrated at not being able to secure meatier roles in Hollywood, Richard jumped at the chance when offered the lead role in The Invincible Gladiator (1961) [The Invincible Gladiator] which was filming in Europe. He wound up settling in Italy for the next two decades. His first role, of course, immediately typed him as another Steve Reeves type and, to avoid being penned in too much as a mythological muscle man, he sought roles in routine spaghetti westerns and spy intrigue. Once Italy closed down film production after the Herculean craze had died down, he, like others, found himself unemployed. He did manage to scrape up work in Hong Kong, but a large portion of them were bottom-of-the-barrel Ninja movies. Remarried in 1978, Harrison had already begun acting less and less while delving into producing and directing. He has retired fully now except perhaps for an occasional script writing assignment.
biography.name: Richard Harrison

biography.bio: Sicilian born actor/writer/director was very popular with European audiences, but largely unknown to the west apart from his portrayal of the villainous SPECTRE agent "Emilio Largo" in the spectacular James Bond film Thunderball (1965). However, due to his heavy accent, Celi's voice was dubbed by Robert Rietty. Two years later Celi popped up in the appalling James Bond spoof Operation Kid Brother (1967) starring Neil Connery brother of Sean Connery. Additional to his many film appearances in Italian productions, Celi spent many years on stage in South America to very positive reviews, and directed three films made in South America, Caiçara (1950), Tico-Tico no fuba (1952)_ and L'Alibi (1969)_. He passed away on February 19th 1986 from a heart attack.
biography.name: Adolfo Celi

biography.bio: Judi West was born on December 15, 1942 in the USA. She is an actress, known for The Fortune Cookie (1966), A Man Called Gannon (1968) and Fantabulous Inc. (1967). She was previously married to John Rubinstein.
biography.name: Judi West

biography.bio: Gustavo D'Arpe is an actor, known for Séduite et abandonnée (1964), The Birds, the Bees and the Italians (1966) and Johnny Yuma (1966).
biography.name: Gustavo D'Arpe

biography.bio: Fabienne Fabre is an actress, known for Les subversifs (1967), Barbarella (1968) and Lettera aperta a un giornale della sera (1970).
biography.name: Fabienne Fabre

biography.bio: Nino Fuscagni was born on February 12, 1937 in Città di Castello, Umbria, Italy as Serafino Fuscagni. He is an actor and assistant director, known for Family Portrait (1962), Adieu Moscou (1987) and Black Joe (1968).
biography.name: Nino Fuscagni

biography.bio: Enzo Fiermonte was born on July 17, 1908 in Bari, Puglia, Italy as Vincenzo Fiermonte. He was an actor and writer, known for Trinity Is STILL My Name! (1971), Rocco and His Brothers (1960) and Grand Prix (1966). He was married to Madeleine Astor and Tosca Manetti. He died on March 22, 1993 in Mentana, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Enzo Fiermonte

biography.bio: Gislaine Barbot is an actress, known for Fantabulous Inc. (1967).
biography.name: Gislaine Barbot

biography.bio: Anita Cortinovis is an actress, known for Fantabulous Inc. (1967).
biography.name: Anita Cortinovis

biography.bio: Silvio Bagolini was born on August 4, 1914 in Bologna, Italy. He was an actor, known for I Vitelloni (1953), Variety Lights (1951) and The Overcoat (1952). He died on September 26, 1976 in Bologna, Emilia-Romagna, Italy.
biography.name: Silvio Bagolini

biography.bio: Aldo Bonamano is an actor, known for Deep Red (1975), Grand Slam (1967) and Death Laid an Egg (1968).
biography.name: Aldo Bonamano

biography.bio: Manlio De Angelis was born on January 9, 1935 in Rome, Lazio, Italy. He is known for his work on Arachnophobia (1990), Once Upon a Time in the West (1968) and Zombie - Le crépuscule des morts-vivants (1978).
biography.name: Manlio De Angelis

biography.bio: Arturo Dominici was born on January 2, 1918 in Palermo, Sicily, Italy. He is known for his work on Enquête sur un citoyen au-dessus de tout soupçon (1970), Black Sunday (1960) and Les travaux d'Hercule (1958). He was married to Liana Dodoja and Irene Quattrini. He died on September 7, 1992 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Arturo Dominici

biography.bio: Giacomo Furia was born on January 2, 1925 in Arienzo, Campania, Italy as Giacomo Matteo Furia. He was an actor and writer, known for Variety Lights (1951), The Gold of Naples (1954) and Death Rage (1976). He died on June 5, 2015 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Giacomo Furia

biography.bio: Virgilio Gazzolo was born in 1936 in Rome, Lazio, Italy. He is known for his work on Don't Torture a Duckling (1972), Augustine of Hippo (1972) and E se per caso una mattina... (1972).
biography.name: Virgilio Gazzolo

actors.character: The Police Commissioner at the Mortuary
